This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=CAMHS.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-05T14:14:33Z Rena Papadopoulos 2015-03-05T14:14:22+00:00 2015-03-05T14:14:22+00:00 FW: International Woman's Day - Blog on Mary Seacole in UK Huffington Post https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAMHS;85cc321c.1503 Dear list members,<br>I have just read Prof Elizabeth Anionwu's piece about Mary Seacole for the international women's day (IWD) and do recommend that you read it if you have 3 minutes to spare. It is inspiring to read about the courage of this remarkable woman. Women worldwide must find ways to empower themselves, and I wonder how Mary Seacole managed to do this more than 150 years ago. On Sunday, let us remember that the IWD is not just about flowers and chocolate but about gender equality. The fight goes on....<br>rena [...] Rena Papadopoulos 2015-03-05T13:19:13+00:00 2015-03-05T13:19:13+00:00 I am looking for a Research Fellow in Nursing https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAMHS;12b2ac5a.1503 Dear list members,<br>The following advertisement appeared today on Middlesex University's external website:<br>Research Fellow in Nursing<http://www.mdx.ac.uk/__data/assets/pdf_file/0016/216304/HED132-Research-Fellow-in-Nursing.pdf><br>HED<br>Campus: Hendon<br>Grade: 7<br>Period: Fixed Term (18 months), 2 days per week (0.4 FTE)<br>Job Ref: HED132<br>Closing date: 18 March 2015<br><br>For more information please go to:<br>http://www.mdx.ac.uk/about-us/work-for-us/job-vacancies<br><br>Dr Irena Papadopoulos,<br>Professor of Transcultural Health and Nursing,<br>Head, Research Centre for Transcultural Studies in Health,<br>School of Health and Education,<br>Middlesex University,<br>The Burroughs,<br>London NW4 4BT,<br>UK.<br>Tel: +44 208 441 6626 [...] Rena Papadopoulos 2015-03-02T11:40:59+00:00 2015-03-02T11:40:59+00:00 FW: [SPAM: 56.179] CHAIN targeted message: Funding opportunities from The Florence Nightingale Foundation (target group:UK, [job title] nurs,cns,matron, midwife, sister; N=1767) https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAMHS;acbe4af7.1503 This is for nurses who are working in the UK.<br>Some really good opportunities. Check them out!<br>rena<br><br>Dr Irena Papadopoulos,<br>Professor of Transcultural Health and Nursing,<br>Head, Research Centre for Transcultural Studies in Health,<br>School of Health and Education,<br>Middlesex University,<br>The Burroughs,<br>London NW4 4BT,<br>UK.<br>Tel: +44 208 441 6626<br><br>Follow me on Twitter @irena_pap<https://twitter.com/irena_pap><br>Follow me on ResearchGate<https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Irena_Papadopoulos/topics><br>Please visit www.ieneproject.eu<http://www.ieneproject.eu/><br>Please visit http://www.europeantransculturalnurses.eu/index.htm [...] Rankin, Peter 2015-02-28T20:06:04+00:00 2015-02-28T20:06:04+00:00 A background to DCD and recent changes to diagnosis and recommendations https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAMHS;1b393fb6.1502 Developmental Coordination Disorder<br>3 June 2015<br><br>A background to DCD and recent changes to diagnosis and recommendations<br>This day will provide an opportunity to update clinicians and researchers on changes to diagnostic criteria and recent clinical recommendations for Developmental Coordination Disorder to include presentations/workshops from internationally recognised experts.<br><br>The DCD Symposium offers morning sessions to include updates from the European Academy of Childhood Disability guidelines and the newly published DSM-V diagnostic criteria for recognition and mechanisms for diagnosis and treatment and research evidence updates. We are expecting 200 people which is amazing!<br>regards,<br>rena Angela Kydd 2015-02-28T07:42:23+00:00 2015-02-28T07:42:23+00:00 Re: Launching VICTcORY!!! https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAMHS;64b971c0.1502 Dear Rena<br>I have joined and hope I can edit my details as I did not add my publications as I was on my iPad so will go in later and edit if I can. This is a fabulous resource!<br>I am excited to have had a paper accepted at the etna conference and am so looking forward to meeting you and other members. Congratulations on victory - I love your poetic licence on the acronym!<br>Regards<br>Angela [...] Rena Papadopoulos 2015-02-27T16:08:23+00:00 2015-02-27T16:08:23+00:00 Launching VICTcORY!!! https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAMHS;9e4f3b2f.1502 Dear friends,<br>I am pleased to inform you that I have just launched a new website called VICTcORY.!<br><br>I invite you to visit the site at http://cultureandcompassion.com/ and consider becoming a VICTcORY collaborator. This is the beginning of a site which I hope it will become full of contributions from people around the world who are interested in culture and compassion in health and social care. Hopefully members of this list and my other list CAMHS@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<mailto:CAMHS@JISCMAIL.AC.UK> will be interested. I have forwarded your email to an associate from a London Hospital Trust and asked them to contact you if they are interested.<br>If you wish to circulate further you may like to contact Christiana Kouta the secretary of ETNA who can distribute to the ETNA membership list.<br>Hope this helps,<br>rena [...] Rena Papadopoulos 2015-02-18T15:14:52+00:00 2015-02-18T15:14:52+00:00 Re: Animated MH and Deaf Communication films made by young people / service users at CAMHS https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAMHS;240823c.1502 Thank you for sharing your resources with us Simon. I have just had a look at some of the videos and think they are very good and very useful. I recommend them to the list members. Please view and share!<br>Regards,<br>rena<br><br>Dr Irena Papadopoulos,<br>Professor of Transcultural Health and Nursing,<br>Head, Research Centre for Transcultural Studies in Health,<br>School of Health and Education,<br>Middlesex University,<br>The Burroughs,<br>London NW4 4BT,<br>UK.<br>Tel: +44 208 441 6626 [...] simon@biomation.org.uk 2015-02-18T14:29:14+00:00 2015-02-18T14:29:14+00:00 Animated MH and Deaf Communication films made by young people / service users at CAMHS https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAMHS;e242d10.1502 Hello,<br><br>We work with young people and CAMHS professionals to make engaging animated<br>films about mental health issues. The films are carefully created to give a<br>voice to the young people, and to get across often difficult or 'boring'<br>information in an interesting and, if we can, funny way. We want to get these<br>films used as far and wide as possible, as feedback we get from clinicians<br>identifies the strong impact they have. We have some local organisations bringing YP and parents but if anyone wants to attend with a parent and/or young person let us know. Happy New Year! Steven<br><br>Steven Pryjmachuk, PhD PGDipEd RN (Mental Health) CPsychol SFHEA | Professor of Mental Health Nursing Education | Director of Undergraduate Education | School of Nursing, Midwifery & Social Work | Jean McFarlane Building (Room 6.316) | The University of Manchester | Oxford Road | Manchester | M13 9PL | Email: steven.pryjmachuk@manchester.ac.uk<mailto:steven.pryjmachuk@manchester.ac.uk> | PA Mary Delaney: +44 (0) 161 306 7862 | Direct: +44 (0) 161 306 7859 | Reception: +44 [...] Martin Pratt 2015-01-06T10:57:31+00:00 2015-01-06T10:57:31+00:00 Aggression, violence and conduct disorders: bringing together basic science, prevention and treatment https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAMHS;31aee58.1501 2015 Emanuel Miller Memorial Lecture and Annual Conference: Aggression, violence and conduct disorders: bringing together basic science, prevention and treatment Date: Friday 6 March 2015 Venue: Conference Centre, Regent\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds University London, Inner Circle, Regent\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Park, London, NW1 4NS This day meeting brings an outstanding line up of speakers who are world renowned clinicians and researchers. Full details, including bios of our excellent speakers, are below:<br><br>CAUGHT IN THE WEB: IS THE INTERNET GOOD FOR YOUR MENTAL HEALTH?26/11/14 18.30 - 20.30, Richard Hoggart Building Cinema, Goldsmiths, University of London, New Cross, SE14 6NW<br>2014 is the year that the World Wide Web turned 25. It’s now an adult, as are the generation who grew up alongside it. For you information, I have attached a flyer which gives details on how to enrol. Please pass the flyer on to your friends, colleagues and co-workers.
